author: Editor
title: 11 hotel rewards promotions you shouldn’t miss this fall
text:
Posted on October 9, 2015 by Editor Photo credit, Reverie Saigon 
Miles and points collectors know a good deal when they see one, but sometimes promotions fly under the radar. So each month we’ll bring you the best deals for frequent fliers and the best promotions for frequent hotel guests to help you fatten up your points piggy bank. Here are 11 of the best deals major hotel rewards programs are offering right now: Photo credit, Best Western 
Best Western 
1. Recently rebranded Best Western will send you a $25 gift card for two separate stays any time between now and Nov. 22. Register for the promotion before you stay. Photo credit, Hilton 
Hilton Hhonors 
2. Hilton is offering triple points for weekend night stays (Friday through Sunday) and double points Mondays through Thursdays. Those can add up quickly, especially at more expensive properties. 
3. Earn 2,000 bonus points per night at Waldorf-Astoria and Conrad hotels between now and the end of the year. 
4. If you pay for your stay with a Visa card at 77 participating hotels in the Asia Pacific region, you can earn double points after you sign up for this offer. Photo credit, IHG 
Intercontinental Hotels Group 
5. Accelerate your earnings with this fall promotion from IHG. Offers are targeted and may vary per customer, but include bonus points or free hotel nights for stays between now and Dec. 31. One of the best offers is staying in an IHG family hotel four separate times and earning two free nights certificates. Photo credit, Marriott 
Marriott 
6. Marriott’s signature Mega Bonus promotion is back for the fall with targeted offers for customers that include double points beginning with your second stay, earn 2,000 bonus points per stay beginning with the second stay (up to 20,000 maximum), and earning a stash of points after completing a specified number of nights. 
7. If you’re in a bind and need more American Airlines miles, Marriott will give you a 20% bonus in miles for transferring points from Marriott to American Airlines. The transfer rate varies depending on how many points your transfer, but the discounted rate starts at 8,000 Marriott points for 2,000 Aadvantage points and maxes out at 112,000 Marriott points for 50,000 Aadvantage points. Considering Aadvantage points are worth about 2.4 times more than Marriott points ( 1.7 center per point versus .7 cents per point ) this deal is only worth it if transfer at least 24,000 points. Photo credit, Starwood 
Starwood 
8. Starwood has a number of lucrative promotions this fall including Select Member Exclusives only available for targeted members. The offers vary, but include options like bonus points for staying in select cities or incremental point increases for staying a certain number of times during the promotion period. Register by Nov. 30 to see if you’re eligible. 
9. Even if you’re not qualified for the above promotion, don’t fret. Everyone can sign up for the Stay for More offer valid between now and Dec. 20, offering up double points for stays of two nights or longer, plus a bonus of 500 points for stays of three nights or more. 
10. To celebrate its new boutique hotel brand, SPG is doling out up to 10,000 bonus points for stays at Tribute Portfolio hotels between now and Dec. 20. But, there are only a handful of hotels so far. Let’s hope you’re traveling to London, Miami Beach, or Palm Springs! 
11. If you’re a meeting planner, the SPG Pro Double Double brings twice as many points for organizing an event between now and Dec. 31. The event can even be next year, but you have to book it in 2015.
